snippet: Joseph D’Amico, who was appointed the agency’s superintendent by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo in 2011, said he wanted to “pursue other opportunities.”
abstract: New York State Police Superintendent Joseph D’Amico announces his retirement, saying he has agreed to stay on until replacement is hired; Gov Andrew M Cuomo appointed D'Amico in 2011, hoping he would repair image of scandal-plagued state police force.

byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Joseph D’Amico, who was appointed the agency’s superintendent by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo in 2011, said he wanted to “pursue other opportunities.”

headline.main: New York State Police Leader Is Stepping Down
headline.print_headline: State Police Superintendent  Stepping Down After 5 Years
